symptoms.name: Rash
symptoms.pattern: May be present, initially pink spots, darkening later

symptoms.name: Gastrointestinal symptoms
symptoms.pattern: May be present in murine typhus

symptoms.name: Central nervous system abnormalities
symptoms.pattern: May be present, more common and severe in epidemic typhus

symptoms.name: Delirium
symptoms.pattern: May be present in epidemic typhus

symptoms.name: Coma
symptoms.pattern: May be present in epidemic typhus

symptoms.name: Seizures
symptoms.pattern: May be present in epidemic typhus

physical_findings: Rash (initially pink spots, later darkening into pustules)
risk_factors: Exposure to infected body lice (epidemic typhus)
Exposure to infected flying squirrels (epidemic typhus)

required: Clinical presentation consistent with typhus (fever, headache, rash, etc.)
supportive: Positive serological testing for Rickettsia typhi or Rickettsia prowazekii
